channel.title: [BS]Allowing others to connect[BS]
channel.description:
Okay so right now this is my second day on trying to figure out how to run the server. So far I've got some of the parts but one which I tried so many times is letting others connect to my server.
Since I'm using battlescape source it's kind of confusing. This is the client I was using when I downloaded the source with it.
[url=http://dl.dropbox.com/u/9098208/Client.zip]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/9098208/Client.zip[/url]
Anyone could please help me? I want to let my friends come on and just mess around.
Do I have to edit anything in the client folder or the server folder? I tried to edit the client.java in the client folder, looked for [code]//public String server = "127.0.0.1";[/code] And changed it to my no-ip.
Saved it and compiled it. And compressed it into a .rar file and uploaded it to a file uploader site, and went on a diff computer, downloaded the file. Hit the run.bat and I got an error.
[email]phantom981@hotmail.com[/email] is my msn username. If anyone would like to help me that'd be much appreciated and I will rep you.
Thankyou very much.

item.dc:creator: @Untrimmed Untrimmed
item.description:
@Untrimmed wrote:

FatMan223:

I did remove the //'s just comes up with an error when I try to compile.

Post the error?

item.description:
@I_am_beast wrote:

First off, It took me 2 years to figure out how to make a server go online. I was clueless.
Second off, What base? It could be in your gui class depending on the base.

[quote=“FatMan223, post:1, topic:413704”]Okay so right now this is my second day on trying to figure out how to run the server. So far I’ve got some of the parts but one which I tried so many times is letting others connect to my server.

Since I’m using battlescape source it’s kind of confusing. This is the client I was using when I downloaded the source with it.

http://dl.dropbox.com/u/9098208/Client.zip

Anyone could please help me? I want to let my friends come on and just mess around.

Do I have to edit anything in the client folder or the server folder? I tried to edit the client.java in the client folder, looked for //public String server = "127.0.0.1"; And changed it to my no-ip.

Saved it and compiled it. And compressed it into a .rar file and uploaded it to a file uploader site, and went on a diff computer, downloaded the file. Hit the run.bat and I got an error.

phantom981@hotmail.com is my msn username. If anyone would like to help me that’d be much appreciated and I will rep you.

Thankyou very much.[/quote]

remove the “//”?
